intro: Erythrina costaricensis, commonly known as the scarlet coral tree, is a striking tropical plant native to Central America. It is a leguminous species, belonging to the family Fabaceae, and is characterized by its vibrant red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with three leaflets and produces distinctive pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its showy appearance. Erythrina costaricensis also plays a role in nitrogen fixation, contributing to soil fertility through its symbiotic relationship with nitrogen-fixing bacteria.
